start.title: Lobby
start.text:
You have entered through the glass doors and are now standing in the lobby of the school. It is evident that there haven't been any cleaners here for a while, but the place is not falling apart.

To your left is a large corkboard with papers and flyers pinned to it. In front of you is a long hallway with lockers on either side.

corkboard.title: Corkboard
corkboard.text: You examine the corkboard and see numerous papers and flyers pinned to it. There are some 'Missing Children' posters and general news articles. There is also a flyer for an autumn prom that looks rather lovely.

longHallway.title: Long Hallway
longHallway.text:
You proceed along a long, straight hallway. On either side of you are lockers, some open yet empty. A series of lamps light up the hallway, although some are broken or flickering. You notice more signs of age and wear, as well as indications of animals having moved in.

You reach a junction in the hallway. To your left is a door to the nurse's office. To your right is another hallway that leads towards the principal's office. Straight ahead is a shorter hallway that connects to some classrooms.

choices.text: Enter the nurse's office on your left
Turn right towards the principal's office

nursesOffice.title: Nurse's Office
nursesOffice.text:
You enter a squeaky clean nurse's office. It looks as if it was cleaned perhaps a few hours ago. Everything is perfectly orderly and organized, despite the fact that no living soul has been here in years.

On one side, you notice a door with a window where you can see a staircase leading down to a basement of some sort. The door has a combination lock, but you aren't certain where the code could be.

basement.title: Basement
basement.text:
You descend into an equally spotless basement, towards a light with a wire hanging from it. As you pull on the wire to turn on the light, you hear something move in the darkness ahead. You turn on the light, revealing shelves lining the walls, filled with jars containing brains. There are at least fifty of them.

At the far end of the basement, you see what made the noise: an abomination. A man cruelly merged with metal, with large blades protruding from various parts of his flesh. Crude clockwork mechanisms are fitted to his joints, and he looks up at you with fear and shame.

He tries to speak, but you can see scars where his vocal cords once were. With jerky movements, he points to a message scratched into the wall: 'I don't know who I am or how long I have been here. I am in constant pain. If anyone reads this, please put me out of my misery.' He looks at you with pleading eyes, hoping you will fulfill his request.

choices.text: Go back to the nurse's office

code.title: Code
code.text: The shattered man notices your intention, and a sad smile crosses his face. You see him mouth 'Wait' as he scratches another message onto the wall: 'Remember BRAINS.' Once finished, he nods towards the message and closes his eyes, waiting for you to end his suffering. You walk up behind him and stop the system powering his clockwork heart.
